channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Beirut's day of destruction: Explosion lays waste to Lebanese capital
item.description: The industrial port that provides Lebanon with crucial trade routes was virtually flattened by the blast, which is believed by officials to have been caused at a warehouse storing ammonium nitrate.

item.title: Beirut explosion: At least 50 dead, thousands injured in blast
item.description: The country's health minister said more than 3,700 have been wounded following the blast at the city's port, where warehouses are believed to contain explosive materials.

item.title: Ruined endangered Unesco sites from Palmyra to Jerusalem are virtually rebuilt before your very eyes
item.description: Architects and engineers have deployed digital wizardry to show what several Unesco sites would have looked like had they been fully preserved - to underscore their sheer majesty.

item.title: Virgin Atlantic is Branson's second airline to file for bankruptcy
item.description: Virgin Atlantic's filing on Tuesday in U.S. bankruptcy court in the Southern District of New York said it has negotiated a deal with stakeholders 'for a consensual recapitalization'.

item.title: Foreign Office says of British embassy workers suffered 'non-life-threatening' injuries in Beirut
item.description: A Foreign Office spokesperson said a small number of staff sustained non-life threatening injuries in the explosion and are receiving medical attention where necessary.

item.title: Beirut port blast comes amid rising tensions between Lebanon and its neighbour
item.description: Lebanon's interior minister said initial information indicated highly explosive material that had been stored at the port had blown up. Israel, which has fought several wars with Lebanon, denied any role.

item.title: Kate Middleton dons £15 face mask by Amaia as she unpacks donations at a baby bank in Sheffield
item.description: Kate Middleton, 38, visited a baby bank in Sheffield on Tuesday, During her visit, she helped to unload a pallet of deliveries before speaking with families about their experience of baby banks.

item.title: Downfall of the REAL Don Juan
item.description: His passion for exclusive sports, from hunting and shooting to skiing and yacht-racing, has been matched only by the vigour with which he has pursued women, clocking up roughly 5,000 partners.

item.title: 15 tips for free family fun: Our ideas to keep the kids entertained
item.description: After months stuck at home, many parents are running out of ideas to keep the kids entertained. With budgets tight, here we have rounded up 15 tips for free (or almost free) family fun.

item.title: How to stay afloat in a tsunami of job cuts: Millions face redundancy
item.description: This country has faced mass job losses before but rarely on this scale. The latest predictions say unemployment could rise to 10 per cent by the end of the year.

item.title: Man with last song syndrome jumped to death from viaduct
item.description: Anthony Wayne Walters, 55, left a note saying he had a song going round in his head all the time which 'killed him'. The former takeaway worker died after falling from Pontwalby viaduct in January.

item.title: Body of former SDLP leader John Hume arrives at cathedral ahead of funeral
item.description: Members of the Social Democratic and Labour Party (SDLP) John Hume led for two decades formed a guard of honour as his body arrived at St Eugene's Cathedral in Londonderry.

item.title: Police commander in charge of drug strategy is suspended over alleged drug misuse
item.description: Commander Julian Bennett, who wrote the Metropolitan Police's drug strategy from 2017 to 2021, was secretly suspended last month following claims involving controlled drugs.

item.title: King Carlos is 'staying in the Dominican Republic' after being 'forced into exile'
item.description: Online newspaper El Confidencial said Juan Carlos was in Portugal, where he spent part of his youth, at the town of Azeitao, 18 miles south of the capital Lisbon.

item.title: UTV presenter dies after his car plunges into water at harbour
item.description: Mr Black, aged in his 70s, was pulled from Strangford Harbour, in Co Down, Northern Ireland, after bystanders reported a car in the water. He was taken to hospital where he died from his injuries.

item.title: Ex-F1 driver Eddie Irvine partied with Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Former Formula One race car driver Eddie Irvine, 54, revealed he once partied with Bill Clinton at one of Jeffrey Epstein's lavish parties.

item.title: Brexit referendum 'sparked rise in Britons migrating to the EU'
item.description: Flows from the UK to countries in the bloc have risen 30 per cent since the referendum, with researchers suggesting around half of that increase was driven by the decision to cut ties.

item.title: Covid 'will cost THREE MILLION UK travel and tourism jobs', bosses warn
item.description: Bosses said research conducted two months ago predicted this 'worst case scenario' would occur if barriers to global travel remained in place.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: The last of the Aspreys leaves London after 240 years
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE They are the family to whom generations of the Royal Family have turned whenever augmenting their jewellery collections.

item.title: CDC warns of outbreak of child-paralyzing disease this fall
item.description: The rare temporarily or permanently paralyzing disease acute flaccid myelitis resurfaces and strikes children about every other year, making a 2020 outbreak likely, CDC officials said Tuesday.

item.title: Cat that went missing on a Scottish camping holiday is found - 12 years later
item.description: Tortoiseshell-and-white Georgie travelled with the Davies family from Rochdale to the Rowardennan campsite by Loch Lomond before vanishing when they went home in October 2008.

item.title: How to hunt down a job if the worst happens
item.description: Re-entering the jobs market can be a bewildering experience at the best of times, let alone during a global pandemic. We have spoken to market experts to help you get back on the ladder.

item.title: Twitter 'Things to Consider before Marriage' checklist goes viral
item.description: A Twitter user from California is going viral for a thread packed with advice for what people should do before they get married. So far over 220,000 people have liked it.

item.title: Putin's man in London says 'mud-slinging' means our relationship with Moscow is 'close to frozen'
item.description: In his first major newspaper interview since his appointment last year, Vladimir Putin's ambassador Andrei Kelin (pictured) denied claims that his nation had interfered in British politics.

item.title: Ten-page licence fee documents for over-75s are too 'long and complex', charity warns BBC
item.description: Age UK said the documents fail to make it clear when the elderly will get a demand for payment after millions lost their right to a free licence.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein WAS a member at Mar-a-Lago, book claims
item.description: New book The Grifter's Club makes shocking claims about what goes on at Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Florida.

item.title: Salman Rushdie warns that Left-wing 'cancel culture' is a threat to literature and freedom of speech
item.description: Responding to the idea that authors should write only 'what they know' or risk being 'cancelled', the Booker Prize winner said he could not accept that 'there are areas in which censorship is acceptable'.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Three's company for Mountbatten sisters Ella, Alix and Luli
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE While the Queen left Windsor Castle start a low-key summer holiday at Balmoral with Prince Philip, members of her extended family are travelling farther afield.

item.title: Kate Moss, 46, wears tiny black bikini on yacht in Ibiza
item.description: Kate, 46, stripped down to a skimpy black bikini for her day on board, showing off the results of her clean-living rituals after ditching her party-going lifestyle two years ago.

item.title: ROSS CLARK: Workshy Whitehall is wrecking the recovery
item.description: ROSS CLARK: An Investigation by the Mail has shown Whitehall workers are among the worst offenders when it comes to failing to get back to work. Pictured, the Square Mile on Monday.

item.title: Meet the women denied state pension payments who finally got their due
item.description: Anne Psaros, 79, was delighted to be handed £11,600 after realising that the DWP had failed to upgrade her pension to the married woman's rate when husband retired more than ten years ago.

item.title: Plug-in baby: Daughter with heart defect is now a lively toddler
item.description: Lacey-Janet Ambler, who was born in Newcastle with a major heart defect, had already survived a respiratory arrest, seizures and had open-heart surgery by 23 days old.

item.title: Doctors warn of a devastating toll on non-virus patients who face delays in diagnosis and care
item.description: Those suffering from cancer, heart conditions, strokes, diabetes and lung disease are among the worst affected by delays to their diagnosis and care, a survey of senior doctors reveals.

item.title: Four people killed after Tropical Storm Isaias hits, NC, Maryland and New York City
item.description: Four people have been killed in North Carolina, Maryland and New York City after Tropical Storm Isaias toppled trees, spawned tornadoes and brought down torrential rain.

item.title: Stray cat has ears REMOVED after getting sunburned
item.description: The plea was issued when Kahlo, from Tunbridge Wells, was taken in by Cats Protection after giving birth to five kittens.

item.title: Drowning man rescued swimming 100 feet from Dorset shore
item.description: Rescuers dragged the man onto Southbourne beach, near Portman Ravine, after he was paddled to shore with a bodyboard. The man collapsed on the beach and vomited.

item.title: Three sisters who ran all-female fraud gang are jailed
item.description: Lynsey Burdon (pictured), 36, and Emmiline, 29, from Manchester, were jailed for over two years at Chester Crown Court today and Sarah, 40, was sentenced to 18 weeks for her lesser role in the scam.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Students crowd corridors as schools return
item.description: Students across the country resumed in-person classes on Monday for the first time since March with schools reopening in parts of Georgia, Louisiana, Mississippi and Tennessee.

item.title: Ex-WHO doctor says world will be fighting coronavirus for years
item.description: Dr Larry Brilliant, an epidemiologist from California, said the global fight against COVID-19 will carry on for at least the next four years as the virus moves from one hotspot to the next.

item.title: £100 fines for breaching North-West lockdown from MIDNIGHT
item.description: From midnight in Greater Manchester you can only stay overnight with someone from another household if you were previously in a bubble with them.

item.title: 6' 4" model gets creepy DMS from men asking to CLIMB her
item.description: Emerald Van Langen, a 32-year-old nutrition manager and model from Toronto, Canada, was told she was 'too tall' to be a model but has found a niche online.

item.title: Another 120 migrants on eight boats stream into Dover in a day
item.description: Pictures show men wearing masks and lifejackets being brought into the port of Dover in Kent on a Border Force speedboat as eight small boats were intercepted by Border Force today.

item.title: Tourist snaps toes off 200-year-old sculpture at Italian museum
item.description: The tourist, who has been revealed as a 50-year-old man from Austria, leaned on the 'Paolina Borghese Bonaparte as Venus Victrix' artwork while posing for a photograph.

item.title: Irate KFC and Pret customers claim they can't get half-price meals at some branches
item.description: Some irate patrons at KFC in the UK said managers claimed the Monday to Wednesday discount only applied in the afternoon, enforced a £10 minimum spend and asked to see a voucher.

item.title: Rafael Nadal PULLS OUT of this year's US Open amid concerns over coronavirus
item.description: His announcement came just hours after the clay court Madrid Open announced that it was not going ahead in September due to the rising number of Covid-19 cases in the Spanish capital.

item.title: Florida teen, 17, pleads not guilty to 'masterminding' Twitter hack
item.description: Graham Ivan Clark pleaded not guilty to multiple fraud charges Tuesday over the Twitter hack that took control of the accounts of politicians, celebs and technology moguls back on July 15.

item.title: Coronavirus: Post-menopausal women may be at higher risk
item.description: Post-menopausal women were 22 per cent more likely to report symptoms of Covid-19 than women who still had periods, King's College London found.

item.title: Dr Dre's wife Nicole Young claims he tore up prenup to his $800M fortune
item.description: Dr Dre's wife Nicole Young claims she did sign a prenup to his $800M fortune in 1996 before they tied the knot. But the 50-year-old Young said that the 55-year-old rapper tore it up.

item.title: Chinese state media accuses Trump of trying to steal TikTok
item.description: Chinese state media is accusing President Trump of trying to steal TikTok by forcing the sale of its US arm to Microsoft, saying it is part of America's 'decoupling' strategy.

item.title: Twitter investigated by FTC for misusing users' private data
item.description: In a regulatory filing on Monday, Twitter said it received a draft FTC complaint alleging violations between 2013 and 2019. It is estimating a loss of up to $250M in settlement charges.

item.title: Parking space row escalates as neighbour cages car in scaffold
item.description: Police were called to the incident when the owner of a blue VW Passat found his vehicle completely trapped in the makeshift construction, on an estate in Haywards Heath, West Sussex.

item.title: Woman reports NBA player-turned-psychologist to his OWN company
item.description: Clementine Fandango, from Cardiff, complained to Amaechi Performance Systems, a Manchester-based consultancy firm, about John Amaechi.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Interactive map shows worst-hit areas
item.description: Data shows that Shearbridge, a neighbourhood in the south west of Bradford, near the city's university, was the worst-hit place in the entire last week, recording 32 new cases.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein kinks exposed in Ghislaine Maxwell documents
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein's alleged sexual kinks were laid bare in legal filings from a 2015 lawsuit against his accused madam Ghislaine Maxwell, unsealed by a judge on Thursday.

item.title: Light aircraft crashes and bursts into flames in Sussex
item.description: The plane came down in Herrings Lane in Heathfield shortly after 11am today. Police and ambulance crews responded to the incident while firefighters doused out the flames.

item.title: Now Donald Trump PROMOTES mail-in voting in Florida
item.description: President Donald Trump has increasingly sought to cast doubt on the election and the expected pandemic-induced surge in mail-in and absentee voting.

item.title: Trump tweets 'people are not happy' with athletes kneeling
item.description: President Donald Trump took aim at protesting athletes again on Tuesday, but despite his claims that many people are upset about the demonstrations, the leagues' TV ratings have stayed strong.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper murder: Killers' jail terms to be reviewed
item.description: Henry Long, 19, and 18-year-olds Jessie Cole and Albert Bowers were sentenced at the Old Bailey on Friday for manslaughter.

item.title: 'I was living in hell': The harrowing torment of Will Young's twin Rupert and the demons he battled
item.description: Will Young's brother Rupert had bravely spoken about his mental health battles and how he was once plunged so deep in depression he was homeless on the streets drinking with tramps

item.title: Britain will melt in 99F temperatures by the weekend as Met Office issues health alert
item.description: The scorching air from Europe at the end of the week will come with the wet weather predicted for the north west today expected to clear away tomorrow. Pictured: A jogger passes the Shard.

item.title: The black train guard who overturned ban on non-white BR staff
item.description: Asquith Xavier overturned a ban on non-white staff at British Railways in the 1960s.

item.title: 'Stay at Home' messaging 'may have led to a spike in heart attack deaths'
item.description: University of Leeds experts found heart attack admissions dropped by 40 per cent in April and May in England. They say it may have been an 'unintended consequence' of Stay At Home' slogan.

item.title: Queen and Prince Philip fly to Balmoral after months' isolation
item.description: The Queen and Prince Philip travelled by private jet from RAF Northolt, in west London, to Aberdeen airport where they were met by driver and taken to Balmoral, roughly an hour away.

item.title: SpaceX Starship rocket 'hop' aborted after tests that resulted in a 100-foot plume of liquid oxygen
item.description: SpaceX was set to conduct a 500ft 'hop' of its Starship prototype, but wass been aborted around 12:00pm ET. The rocket began spilling out liquid oxygen, creating a nearly 100-foot high plume..

item.title: Man accidentally sets fire to flat with wedding proposal candles
item.description: The groom-to-be left the lit tea lights in a room filled with balloons in his flat on Abbeydale Road in Sheffield. He went to fetch his girlfriend from work and returned to the flat enveloped in flames.

item.title: Weekly coronavirus deaths fall more than a quarter in seven days
item.description: Department of Health chiefs confirmed another 670 Britons had tested positive for the life-threatening disease - down from yesterday's six-week high of 938.

item.title: Mother wakes up daughter, 21, by 'licking her like a puppy'
item.description: In tonight's episode of TLC's sMothered, Marcia, 68, from the US, shares her unusual morning routine with daughter Alena, 21 - and admits 'I walk into her room and just lick her all up,'

item.title: Tripadvisor reveals world's best experiences for 2020
item.description: They have both been honoured in the 2020 Travellers' Choice Experiences awards, with the Chicago Architecture River Cruise snaring the top accolade in the U.S.

item.title: Mayor of Devon town dubbed 'Chelsea-on-Sea' hits out at 'disrespectful' tourists
item.description: Thousands of tourists and second home owners flocked back to Salcombe in Devon from the moment the green light was given by the Government for people to go on holidays at the start of last month.

item.title: Ex-EastEnders star Katie Jarvis 'arrested for drunken pub fight and being racially abusive'
item.description: Former EastEnders actress Katie Jarvis was allegedly arrested on Southend seafront in Essex on Friday on suspicion of a racially aggravated public order offence following a brawl.

item.title: Primary school teacher is sacked over secret affair with pupil's father
item.description: Ann Brenen, 42, from South Shields, was sacked from Westoe Crown Primary School after it was revealed she was in a sexual relationship with one of her pupils' fathers.

item.title: Legendary designer Gordon Murray reveals £3m T.50 British supercar
item.description: The new 3-seat hyperrcar is the culmination of a life's work for legendary car and F1 designer Professor Gordon Murray who says the new 'spiritual successor' to his ground-breaking McLaren F1.

item.title: Model gets backlash for filming man telling her to wear mask
item.description: Instagram model Duana W, 22, filmed a tirade of abuse she suffered from a blue-bearded man at Tottenham Court Road station on Sunday for not wearing a face mask.

item.title: Coronavirus: India has world's highest daily deaths and cases
item.description: The 52,972 new cases and 803 fatalities took India, the world's second most populous country, past both the US and Brazil, the first and second in the world for deaths and registered infections.

item.title: Trump dismisses 1,000 average COVID-19 deaths a DAY
item.description: In an interview with Axios on HBO that was filmed last Tuesday but only aired last night, Trump said the virus was well-controlled across the US despite the country averaging about 1,000 deaths per day.

item.title: Coronavirus: Droplets can travel further than thought through air
item.description: University of Edinburgh and Heriot-Wyatt University found both small and large droplets can travel against airflow and made a device that sucks fine particles right out of the air.

item.title: Meghan Markle celebrates her 39th birthday in Los Angeles
item.description: The Queen, 94, wished Meghan Markle a happy 39th birthday in a public show of support amid ongoing controversy surrounding the release of the Sussexes' biography Finding Freedom.

item.title: Black family arrested at gunpoint as cops suspected car theft
item.description: Bystander footage has emerged on social media showing the moment Aurora Police officers in Colorado arrested a driver and a group of young girls in the parking lot of a thrift store on Sunday morning.

item.title: Microwaving tea DOES ruin your cuppa, study finds
item.description: Experts from China have 'stirred the pot' by showing how microwaving tea may ruin your cuppa - but a special silver-rimmed cup could allow it to be heated properly.

item.title: Manchester lockdown sparks north-west England 'identity' crisis
item.description: A major incident was declared by authorities in Greater Manchester this week following a rise in the number of coronavirus infections.

item.title: Ministers admit struggling Covid contact tracing system MUST improve
item.description: Local government minister Simon Clarke conceded there is 'more to do' after a major study warned a resurgence of the disease could be twice as bad as that in the Spring.

item.title: World's 'smallest dinosaur' is actually a LIZARD scientists admit in retraction of study
item.description: Researchers had claimed the fossil skull from Myanmar - which was preserved in amber - came from a hummingbird-sized dinosaur they named 'Oculudentavis khaungraae'.

item.title: Four students at east London sixth form awarded £1m in scholarships to US Ivy league universities
item.description: The students, all from an inner-city East London sixth form, will swap the likes of Tower Hamlets, Beckton and Dagenham for the halls off US Ivy League universities such as Princeton and Harvard.

item.title: 67 Pizza Express restaurants to close across Britain
item.description: Pizza Express has said it could close around 67 of its UK restaurants, with up to 1,100 jobs at risk, as part of a major restructuring plan.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Trump's deluded train-wreck HBO interview proved he's lost control of reality
item.description: In every great American crisis, there is a moment where the world can see the true character of a President. For President Trump, there have been many grim moments during the pandemic.

item.title: TikTok users suggest scrubbing bath with a GRAPEFRUIT
item.description: TikTok reveals the six bathroom cleaning habits we've been doing wrong - including cleaning the taps, toilets and bath tubs. One suggested cleaning the bath with half a grapefruit coated in sugar.

item.title: Outrage as TV historian becomes the second white BBC presenter says the N word on air in three days
item.description: American History's Biggest Fibs presented by Lucy Worsley was aired on Saturday night on BBC Two and is about the history of slavery.
item.media:credit: BBC Two / American History's Biggest Fibs with Lucy Worsley

item.title: Scottish exam chaos as almost 25% of pupils' results marked DOWN after teachers gave highest ever
item.description: Exam bosses responsible for accrediting qualifications in Scotland have marked down 124,564 pupils - after 'optimistic' teachers tried to give them the highest results in history

item.title: Line of Duty fans go wild over how young the stars look in series one
item.description: The first ever episode of the show, which first premiered in 2012, was re-broadcast on BBC1 last night. Fans were struck by the youthful appearance of the show's stars.

item.title: Zara Tindall says Princess Anne is 'professional, caring and honest'
item.description: Princess Anne's daughter Zara Tindall, 39, and her son Peter Phillips, 42, who both live on their mother's Gatcombe Park estate, made the remarks in ITV'S Anne: The Princess Royal At 70.

item.title: Large study debunks myth that Vitamin D reduces risk of mood disorders
item.description: A new study from Massachusetts General Hospital has found that adults taking vitamin D3 supplements did not have fewer depressive symptoms than those taking a placebo.

item.title: Pablo Escobar's first born son describes being rescued from a shootout that left his mother dead
item.description: Roberto Sendoya Escobar, who now lives in Mallorca under his adopted name of Phillip Witcomb, described finding out about his birth father in 1989 as 'an extraordinary moment'.

item.title: Number of NHS patients waiting more than a year for treatment in London has skyrocketed
item.description: In London, 19,775 patients had been waiting more than a year for treatment by July 19, compared with just 1,032 patients across the whole country in March 2019.

item.title: Billionaire Richard Branson set to be first passenger on his Virgin Galactic spaceplane in 2021
item.description: Virgin Galactic founder Richard Branson is set to launch into Earth's orbit aboard the firm's space plane in early 2021. Branson will be the first passenger, paving the way for space tourism.
item.media:description: British billionaire Branson's groundbreaking flight would open the door for commercial trips to begin

item.title: 'Influencer', 48, 'scams £1,236 in bogus refunds for designer clothing'
item.description: Angelica Zabrodina, 48, walked into London TK Maxx stores with her pet chihuahua in her handbag before allegedly fleecing them out of around £1,200, a court has heard.

item.title: Police blast 'reckless' idiots risking lives posing for SELFIES on top of cliffs and waterfalls
item.description: The Devon Rural Affairs policing team has shamed people in dangerous locations, seemingly snapping pictures for social media sites like Instagram and Snapchat.

item.title: Staycation car hire meltdown: Holidaying Britons in frantic scramble to secure a vehicle
item.description: Europcar, a French firm that operates in 140 countries worldwide, has been swamped with angry customers on social media.

item.title: Stacey Dooley 'roamed' maternity ward while fathers banned
item.description: The star met with mothers in Bradford on last night's programme, which investigated how the coronavirus pandemic has changed the way families deal with pregnancy.

item.title: Royal insider says Prince Andrew claims 'difficult to believe'
item.description: Shukri Walker claimed the duke danced and chatted with the Jeffrey Epstein victim - and says she is certain it was the prince because she stepped on his foot and then apologised.

item.title: Shih Tzu wins over thousands of Instagram followers due to Lady Gaga resemblance
item.description: Bontenmaru, five, who is named after a Japanese samurai, and lives in Tokyo, has become an internet star racking up more than 22,000 Instagram followers.

item.title: Amir Khan breaks Manchester lockdown restrictions as he celebrates Eid with his family and friends
item.description: The boxer, 33, broke the imposed lockdown restrictions in Manchester to celebrate Eid with his family and friends in his back garden.

item.title: Coleen vs. Becky round one: the beach! Warring WAGs compete in the lavish holiday stakes
item.description: While the footballers' wives prepare to go head-to-head in court, it appears they are also battling it out in the lavish holiday stakes, as we look at how their dream holidays compare.

item.title: Coronavirus Spain: Majorca hotel closes as ten staff infected
item.description: The Club Cala Barca hotel, in Majorca, has become the first on the holiday island to close after an outbreak of coronavirus sickened 10 staff along with four of their relatives.

item.title: Blood test can diagnose brain damage in hours-old babies
item.description: The prototype test is based on a study of the blood samples of 45 babies in Indian hospitals that experienced oxygen deprivation at birth, known as birth asphyxia.

item.title: Actor gets £45k payout from clinic over 'wonky' hair transplant
item.description: Ivan Luptak (pictured), 38, visited Harley Street's Rejuvenate Hair Clinics Ltd for a consultation in April 2015, saying he wanted 'thicker hair' to boost his self-confidence on stage.

item.title: The Simpson's actor calls out show's decision to stop having white actors play POC characters
item.description: Harry Shearer, 76, who voices multiple characters on The Simpsons including African American doctor Juilius Hibbert, has criticized the show's decision.

item.title: Long Lost Family: Viewers in tears after 'heartbreaking' episode
item.description: Christine Rose, 68, a retired factory supervisor now living in Morecambe, Lancashire, appeared on yesterday's episode, which first aired on ITV last year, looking for her two sisters.

item.title: Roger Federer joins Italy's rooftop tennis stars to exchange a few volleys
item.description: The tennis champion, 38, took a private jet to surprise friends Vittoria Oliveri, 13, and Carola Pessina, 11, at their homes in Finale Ligure, Italy.

item.title: British Vogue editor Edward Enninful denies criticism of Meghan Markle was racism
item.description: Edward Enninful, 47, told Sky News that he 'wouldn't just blame racism' for criticism of the Duchess of Sussex, 39, and suggested it had 'taken a minute' for the royal to 'understand the rules'.

item.title: Female officer, 28, facing sack for 'carrying out sex acts on married sergeant at police station'
item.description: PC Jemma Dicks, 28, allegedly carried out the sex acts at 'various locations and dates' with her sergeant Adam Reed, 40, at the busy Cardiff Central Police Station in south Wales.

item.title: Senior Tory MP accused of rape 'SHOULD be named', says alleged victim
item.description: The former Parliamentary researcher in her 20s reportedly wants the ex-minister identified, insisting it would not put her own anonymity at risk. Pictured, Tory chief whip Mark Spencer yesterday.

item.title: Audi retracts 'provocative' advert with young girl eating banana
item.description: The German manufacturer posted the controversial photo of the little girl to Twitter on Sunday alongside a caption which read: 'Lets your heart beat faster - in every aspect.'

item.title: Plane cabin's seats change colour when they've been cleaned
item.description: Colour psychology could be used in aircraft cabins to reassure passengers they are germ-free. That's if the vision of London-based cabin design studio PriestmanGoode comes to fruition.

item.title: Amazon UK remove shoes described as 'N-word brown'
item.description: The listing was posted by Florence Shakespeare, a company thought to be based in China, and included the N-word in the colour description.

item.title: UB40 singer Duncan Campbell, 62, is hospitalised after suffering a stroke
item.description: UB40 singer Duncan Campbell is recovering in hospital after suffering a stroke.

item.title: 'WAS Epstein killed?' Trump casts doubt on whether Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide in jail
item.description: President Donald Trump was asked why he'd sent well wishes to Ghislaine Maxwell - charged with child sex trafficking - at a recent White House press conference.

item.title: How the two professors leading Oxford University's coronavirus trial and Huawei could profit
item.description: Oxford professors Sarah Gilbert (pictured) and Adrian Hill co-founded the startup Vaccitech in 2016, and its technology has been key in developing the university's Covid-19 jab.

item.title: Lost Viking waterway running across mainland Orkney revealed
item.description: A team of researchers from the Universities of the Highlands and Islands, St Andrews and Wales worked to uncover the lost passage that formed an 'ancient highway'.

item.title: Linda Nolan learned of her devastating cancer diagnosis just half an hour after her sister Anne
item.description: The singer, 61, admitted it's been 'traumatic' losing her hair after undergoing chemotherapy treatment in lockdown, and described her and Anne's joint health battle as 'a double nightmare.'

item.title: Son of gunner whose plane was shot down after WWII raid on Berlin can finally lay him to rest
item.description: It is 'very likely' Sgt Leonard Shrubsall's remains are still inside the wreckage of his Short Stirling Bomber that was shot down over Holland while returning from a raid in Germany in 1943.

item.title: Furlough costs soar by £2billion with more than 100,000 new claims in the last week of July
item.description: Some 9.6 million jobs had been covered by the coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (JRS) up to August 2, Government figures show. This was an increase of 100,000 on the previous week.

item.title: Coleen Rooney hits back at speculation she's pregnant saying 'I've just put weight on'
item.description: The WAG, 34, explained she has 'just put weight on' as she took to Twitter on Monday to address queries from her followers after she was pictured on the beach in Barbados.

item.title: West Midlands schoolgirl is earning hundreds of pounds selling antique bottles from shed in garden
item.description: Betsy-Mae Lloyd, from Wednesbury in the West Midlands, opened her business from a Victorian-style play shed after digging up thousands of old bottles at landfill sites.

item.title: French friends try to pronounce tricky English words - with hilarious results
item.description: Students Tom Carles and Alexandre Durand, both 20, who are currently living in Charleston, South Carolina, have gone viral after they filmed themselves trying to tackle difficult English words.

item.title: Younger Covid-19 patients 'more likely to lose sense of smell and taste' than older patients
item.description: Irish researchers examined 46 infected patients who were asked to assess changes to their smell, known as anosmia, and taste, known as ageusia.

item.title: Is a genital match making service the latest cosmetic surgery craze?
item.description: According to UK-based surgeon Dr Lucy Glancey, lockdown has seen a flurry of couples signing up for a genital match making service. Couples are measured up before receiving adjustments.

item.title: A bug's life! Amazing macro pictures of tiny insects in Indonesia captured on a MOBILE PHONE camera
item.description: An Indonesian photographer has captured a series of amazing macro pictures of tiny insects using a mobile phone camera in West Java, Indonesia.

item.title: Dive-bombing seagulls chase woman on Brighton beach and steal all her fries
item.description: Monique Sveinsson, 46, from Cambridgeshire, was left 'shaking' after she was attacked by the hungry seagulls at Brighton beach on August 3 who launched themselves at her chips.

item.title: In the doghouse! Naughty bulldog puppy Horris destroyed TWO sofas worth £1,200 in a matter of weeks
item.description: B&B owner Julie Ann, from Northumberland, was stunned when she found her one-year-old pup had chewed up a £500 Chesterfield sofa just weeks after eating a £700 couch in her conservatory.

item.title: Viewers are left in tears as Supernanny Jo Frost begs stepfather not to beat his grieving stepson
item.description: Viewers were left sobbing last night after watching E4's Supernanny USA as Jo Frost assisted Brittany and Ralph help their children manage the grief of losing their biological father.

item.title: Boy, 17, 'killed woman in woods before moving her body in wheelie bin'
item.description: The body of Lindsay Birbeck, 47, was discovered by a dog walker at Accrington Cemetery in Lancashire on August 24 last year, the jury in a retrial at Preston Crown Court was told.

item.title: Dog owner reveals how their family pet was left bright blue for FOUR days
item.description: Travel agent Sacha Barbato, 49, from Brandiston, Norfolk, revealed how two-year-old Bessie was left a violent shade of turquoise for almost four days after the mishap on Friday.

item.title: The restaurants offering even better deals than Eat Out to Help Out
item.description: Some UK restaurants are being even more generous than the Eat Out To Help Out scheme and are ditching the £10 limit, while others have extended the scheme throughout September.

item.title: Some COVID-19 survivors suffer psychiatric disorders
item.description: A total of 402 patients at San Raffaele hospital in Milan were assessed as part of a study to see the long-term impacts of the coronavirus on the brain.

item.title: Sir Paul McCartney admits he found it 'hurtful' when people blamed him for breaking up The Beatles
item.description: Reflecting on the misconceptions he faced during his time with the band, the singer, 78, spoke candidly with British GQ on Tuesday about how he felt at the time.

item.title: Adorable moment baby eats pizza for the first time
item.description: The little girl was filmed breaking into a wide smile after taking her very first bite of pizza as her mother observed her reaction at their home in New Bern, North Carolina.

item.title: Sherlock Holmes is honoured in new set of stamps featuring Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman
item.description: Six stamps produced by the Royal Mail will show characters from Sherlock, played by Benedict Cumberbatch, Martin Freeman, Amanda Abbington and Andrew Scott.

item.title: Emoji quiz creator who went viral in lockdown RETURNS with brands edition
item.description: The London-based creator of the popular emoji quizzes that swept social media during lockdown is back with a new edition based around big name brands that she's shared exclusively with FEMAIL.

item.title: Microsoft adds $95BILLION on back of TikTok acquisition talks as Trump gives the tech firm deadline
item.description: Shares of Microsoft rose almost 6% on Monday after it confirmed that it was continuing talks about buying the popular social-media platform TikTok. The gains added $95 billion to Microsoft's worth.
